ns2:group.ns2:title: AWS AI Agent Hackathon: Shape the Future of AI Agents | Amazon Web Services
ns2:group.ns2:description:
Join AWS distinguished engineers and senior leaders as they explore why AI agents represent the next frontier in software development. Learn why the time is now, and why AWS is the best place to build them.
Discover how AWS is transforming AI agent development, and the opportunities available through the AWS AI Agent Hackathon. With $45,000 in prizes, access to AWS experts, and a path to market through AWS Marketplace, builders at every level - from students to enterprises - can leverage the same AI capabilities powering industry-leading software products.
Join us in shaping the future of AI agents - register now, and submit your entry by October 20: https://go.aws/4mZJSw4
Subscribe to AWS: https://go.aws/subscribe
Create a free AWS account: https://go.aws/signup Try AWS for free: https://go.aws/free Connect with an expert: https://go.aws/contact Explore more: https://go.aws/more
Next steps: Explore on AWS in Analyst Research: https://go.aws/reports Discover, deploy, and manage software that runs on AWS: https://go.aws/marketplace Join the AWS Partner Network: https://go.aws/partners Learn more on how Amazon builds and operates software: https://go.aws/library
Do you have technical AWS questions? Ask the community of experts on AWS re:Post: https://go.aws/3lPaoPb
Why AWS? Amazon Web Services is the worldâ€™s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud, enabling customers to build anything they can imagine. We offer the greatest choice of innovative cloud capabilities and expertise, on the most extensive global infrastructure with industry-leading security, reliability, and performance.

ns0:entry.ns0:title: [Amazon Web Services]Why Super Retail Group Trusts AWS with their Customer Data | Amazon Web Services

ns2:group.ns2:title: Why Super Retail Group Trusts AWS with their Customer Data | Amazon Web Services
ns2:group.ns2:description:
Super Retail Group uses AWS to manage their customer data across their four major brands. This allows them to store all their data in one common space and make better decisions when putting their customers first.
Hear from Rick Green, GM of Data Transformation at Super Retail Group on what he likes best about working with AWS.

Hear from Adrien Desbaillets, Co-founder and CEO of Saladstop!, on how Amazon Bedrock allows him to continuously innovate and why this is just the beginning.

ns0:entry.ns0:title: [Amazon Web Services]Amazon Bedrock: Fast-track gen AI from prototype to production | Amazon Web Services

ns2:group.ns2:title: Amazon Bedrock: Fast-track gen AI from prototype to production | Amazon Web Services
ns2:group.ns2:description:
Amazon Bedrock is a comprehensive, secure, and flexible platform for building generative AI applications and agents. Amazon Bedrock connects you to leading foundation models (FMs), services to deploy and operate agents, and tools for fine-tuning, safeguarding, and optimizing models along with knowledge bases to connect applications to your latest data so that you have everything you need to quickly move from experimentation to real-world deployment.
Learn more about Amazon Bedrock: http://go.aws/4mS2vSl

ns0:entry.ns0:title: [Amazon Web Services]How fileAI boosted data accuracy 28x using AWS | Amazon Web Services

ns2:group.ns2:title: How fileAI boosted data accuracy 28x using AWS | Amazon Web Services
ns2:group.ns2:description:
Discover how fileAI, a data infrastructure startup, uses Amazon Web Services (AWS) to transform manual data cleanup into automated, reliable workflows that can scale confidently across enterprises. With Anthropic Claude on Amazon Bedrock and Amazon SageMaker, fileAI processes hundreds of millions of files annually while enabling customers to reallocate 10% of their workforce to high-impact strategic tasks. AWS's scalable microservices architecture has enabled fileAI to achieve 28x more accurate data processing than legacy OCR tools, showcasing how well-architected cloud infrastructure can turn data preparation from a bottleneck into a competitive advantage.
Learn more at: http://go.aws/4q33amH

ns0:entry.ns0:title: [TED]The Grassroots Movement Transforming Public Safety | Aqeela Sherrills | TED

ns2:group.ns2:title: The Grassroots Movement Transforming Public Safety | Aqeela Sherrills | TED
ns2:group.ns2:description:
In 1992, something unprecedented happened in Los Angeles: rival gang members negotiated a historic peace treaty, significantly reducing violence across the city. Aqeela Sherrills, one of the key negotiators of that treaty, continues to bring his vision of community-led peace programs to cities across the US. He shares how the new initiative Scaling Safety is empowering trusted local leaders to redefine public safety and create lasting change from the inside out. (This ambitious idea is part of The Audacious Project, TEDâ€™s initiative to inspire and fund global change.) (Recorded at TED2025 on April 11, 2025)

ns0:entry.ns0:title: [The Verge]ChatGPT's everything app | The Vergecast

ns2:group.ns2:title: ChatGPT's everything app | The Vergecast
ns2:group.ns2:description:
Say this for OpenAI: itâ€™s very good at raising money, and itâ€™s very good at getting attention. David and Jake are joined by The Vergeâ€™s Hayden Field to talk about OpenAIâ€™s demo day, the companyâ€™s app store plans, why itâ€™s trying to build every possible ChatGPT feature all at the same time, and more. After that, the hosts talk about the ongoing popularity of the Sora app, and whether OpenAI has truly built a new kind of social network. Then Hayden has to leave, so David and Jake take on the lightning round to discuss Intel chips, Alex Cooperâ€™s Google deal, Starry internet, and more. #Vergecast #Technology #Podcast
0:00 Intro 00:33 OpenAI Dev Day Overview 03:44 AI Agents and ChatGPT Apps 06:51 OpenAI's Strategy and Challenges 10:15 User Experience and Practical Applications 20:53 OpenAI's Financial and Operational Concerns 23:04 Johnny Ive and OpenAI's Mysterious Device 31:56 Sora 2: The AI-Generated TikTok 48:14 Debating the Staying Power of Sora 50:08 The Future of AI-Generated Content 53:54 The Lightning Round 55:15 Celebrity Endorsements and Tech Marketing 01:04:33 Verizon Acquires Starry 01:11:45 Intel's Panther Lake Chips 01:16:47 Apple's Age-Gating Compliance 01:22:42 Facebook's New Strategy 01:28:11 Conclusion

ns2:group.ns2:title: Property Finder uses AWS to scale secure, AI-powered real estate | Amazon Web Services
ns2:group.ns2:description:
Property Finder, a cloud-native real estate platform, has partnered with AWS since day one. With services like Amazon Bedrock and Amazon Q, the company is embedding AI across its operationsâ€”enhancing scale, speed, and security. CTO Himanshu Niranjani shares how AWS enables innovation with multimodal support, high availability, and robust partner collaboration. His vision is to build a secure, cloud-native real estate platform that serves buyers, agents, and government entities through AI-powered infrastructure.
â€œAWS has been our partner since day one. Their tools, scale, and deep partner support enable us to embed AI across our platform, build secure infrastructure, and serve every real estate customer segment.â€ â€” *Himanshu Niranjani, CTO, Property Finder*
Learn more about how AWS is helping its global customers innovate: http://go.aws/3WtIw1B

ns0:entry.ns0:title: [Amazon Web Services]B2B Commerce Revolution with Lion | Retail Insights with AWS | Amazon Web Services

ns2:group.ns2:title: B2B Commerce Revolution with Lion | Retail Insights with AWS | Amazon Web Services
ns2:group.ns2:description:
Join us for an insightful conversation with Robb Simpson, Group Digital & Data Director at Lion, one of Australasia's most iconic beverage companies, as we explore how a century-old brewery is leading the charge in B2B digital transformation and data commercialization.
In this episode, hosts Isha Dalal (Enterprise Solutions Architect at AWS) and Andrew Bremner (Head of Retail, Travel & Hospitality) dive deep into the rapidly evolving B2B commerce landscape, where digital sales have surged from just 13% in 2019 to 80% today, with the global market racing toward $48 trillion by 2030. Discover how Lion is transforming from a traditional beverage manufacturer into a data-driven powerhouse that creates value for retailers, distributors, and venues across Australia, New Zealand, and the US.
Robb shares valuable insights on AI Strategy, commercializing data to unlock new revenue streams, implementing customer-centric design in B2B environments, and bridging the gap between technology teams and market realities. Explore how Lion's approach to data commercialization is turning every transaction into actionable intelligence, creating win-win partnerships that go far beyond traditional supplier-retailer relationships. From their portfolio of beloved brands like Tooheys, XXXX, James Squire, and Steinlager to their cutting-edge B2B digital platforms, see how Lion is setting new standards for what's possible in beverage industry innovation.
Whether you're a retailer looking to enhance B2B partnerships, a technology leader interested in data commercialization strategies, or a business professional exploring digital transformation in traditional industries, this episode offers valuable insights into the future of B2B commerce and customer-centric innovation.
Visit Lion: https://www.lionco.com/ Learn more about AWS Retail solutions: http://go.aws/4objzDU

ns0:entry.ns0:title: [Amazon Web Services]Introducing Quick Index | Create a comprehensive data repository | Amazon Web Services

ns2:group.ns2:title: Introducing Quick Index | Create a comprehensive data repository | Amazon Web Services
ns2:group.ns2:description:
Amazon Quick Index unifies information from multiple sources, including Salesforce, Confluence, and your internal databases, into a single, secure repository. It seamlessly integrates with your favorite third-party applications, allowing you to leverage this comprehensive data source within your favorite applications.
The result is that you receive more contextualized and data-rich AI responses, whether you are working within a third party application or directly in Amazon Quick Suite.
Learn more about Amazon Quick Index: https://go.aws/quicksuite-index

ns0:entry.ns0:title: [Amazon Web Services]Introducing Amazon Quick Sight | Unlock AI-powered business intelligence | Amazon Web Services

ns2:group.ns2:title: Introducing Amazon Quick Sight | Unlock AI-powered business intelligence | Amazon Web Services
ns2:group.ns2:description:
Amazon Quick Sight, a capability of Amazon Quick Suite, delivers AI-powered business intelligence that transforms data into strategic insights for everyone, enabling faster decisions and better business outcomes through unified intelligence, actionable analytics, and democratized data access. Quick Sight provides unified intelligence across all enterprise data sources, and bridges the critical "last-mile gap" between insights and action with built-in agents for research and automation.
Business users can explore data conversationally, take actions directly from dashboards, and leverage 40+ application integrationsâ€”all while maintaining enterprise-grade security and governance.
Learn more about Amazon Quick Sight: https://go.aws/quicksuite-quicksight

ns0:entry.ns0:title: [Amazon Web Services]Introducing Amazon Quick Automate | Automate complex processes | Amazon Web Services

ns2:group.ns2:title: Introducing Amazon Quick Automate | Automate complex processes | Amazon Web Services
ns2:group.ns2:description:
Amazon Quick Automate, a capability of Amazon Quick Suite, transforms the way enterprises create and maintain complex automations at scale. Users can build sophisticated automations using just natural language instructions or existing documentation. Specialized AI agents collaborate to execute automations, handling everything from UI interactions to application integrations.
As a managed service with usage-based pricing, Quick Automate provides enterprise-grade security and monitoring while eliminating infrastructure management overhead. Through its multi-agent architecture, Quick Automate takes enterprise automation to the next level, seamlessly handling your most complex business-critical processes.
Learn more about Amazon Quick Automate: https://go.aws/quicksuite-automate

ns0:entry.ns0:title: [Amazon Web Services]Introducing Amazon Quick Flows | Create workflows for routine tasks | Amazon Web Services

ns2:group.ns2:title: Introducing Amazon Quick Flows | Create workflows for routine tasks | Amazon Web Services
ns2:group.ns2:description:
Amazon Quick Flows, a capability of Amazon Quick Suite, empowers anyone to create workflows for routine tasks using simple natural language, without requiring any technical skills. Users can get started by simply describing the workflow they are looking to build in their own words. Workflows can be shared and customized, allowing departments to tailor them to their specific use cases.
Quick Flows enables direct execution of actions in popular 3rd party business applications without switching platforms. Quick Flows helps organizations reimagine productivity, equipping teams to automate routine work and concentrate on higher-value objectives.
Learn more about Amazon Quick Flows: https://go.aws/quicksuite-flows
